## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 228, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 880, 604]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 219, 649]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 730, 682]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 89]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 133, 561, 151]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 165, 240, 182]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 194, 384, 212]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 212, 581, 247]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 271, 228, 287]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 291, 752, 330]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 345, 495, 380]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 410, 384, 427]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series \(u_{n} = a + (n - 1)d\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 432, 534, 465]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{1}{2} n(a + l) = \frac{1}{2} n\left\{2a + (n - 1)d\right\}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 488, 336, 504]]<|/det|>
Geometric series \(u_{n} = ar^{n - 1}\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 508, 428, 580]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r} (r\neq 1)\] \[S_{\infty} = \frac{a}{1 - r} (|r|< 1)\]  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 610, 594, 628]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 643, 156, 660]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 670, 583, 720]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc \mathrm{e}^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 765, 242, 782]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[403, 791, 594, 880]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C\] \[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\] \[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[175, 85, 823, 275]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 306, 146, 325]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 306, 690, 327]]<|/det|>
On the axes, draw the graphs of \(y = 5 + \left|3x - 2\right|\) and \(y = 11 - x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 307, 920, 326]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 338, 146, 357]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 338, 737, 357]]<|/det|>
Using the graphs, or otherwise, solve the inequality \(11 - x < 5 + |3x - 2|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 339, 920, 358]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 97, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 146, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 569, 95]]<|/det|>
Expand \((2 - 3x)^{4}\), evaluating all of the coefficients.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 94]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 432, 144, 451]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 428, 920, 476]]<|/det|>
The sum of the first three terms in ascending powers of \(x\) in the expansion of \(\left(2 - 3x\right)^{4}\left(1 + \frac{a}{x}\right)\) is \(\frac{32}{x} +b + cx\), where \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are integers. Find the values of each of \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 451, 920, 470]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 97, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 75, 143, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 75, 895, 96]]<|/det|>
Find the \(x\)-coordinates of the stationary points on the curve \(y = 3\ln x + x^{2} - 7x\), where \(x > 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 920, 110]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 603, 146, 621]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 603, 589, 621]]<|/det|>
Determine the nature of each of these stationary points.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 602, 920, 621]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 504, 89]]<|/det|>
Solve the following simultaneous equations.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 100, 554, 121]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{e}^{x} + \mathrm{e}^{y} = 5\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[443, 120, 554, 138]]<|/det|>
\[2\mathrm{e}^{x} - 3\mathrm{e}^{y} = 8\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 473, 146, 491]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 473, 455, 491]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\mathrm{e}^{(2t - 1)} = 5\mathrm{e}^{(5t - 3)}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 473, 920, 491]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 70, 586, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 87, 479, 106]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[288, 108, 920, 356]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 373, 858, 394]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows triangle \(ABC\) with \(AC = \sqrt{6} - \sqrt{2}\), \(AB = \sqrt{6} + \sqrt{2}\) and angle \(CAB = 60^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 406, 144, 425]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 406, 379, 425]]<|/det|>
Find the exact length of \(BC\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 406, 920, 425]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 636, 144, 655]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 631, 415, 658]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\sin ACB = \frac{\sqrt{6} + \sqrt{2}}{4}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 637, 920, 656]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 778, 143, 797]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 777, 655, 797]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 778, 920, 797]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 84, 94, 104]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 524, 114]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{d}x^{2}} = \mathrm{e}^{2x} + \frac{1}{(x + 1)^{2}}\) for \(x > - 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 128, 143, 148]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 125, 631, 153]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\) given that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = 2\) when \(x = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 129, 920, 149]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 364, 146, 382]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 363, 611, 383]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(y\) given that \(y = 4\) when \(x = 0\).

<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 912, 116]]<|/det|>
Variables \(x\) and \(y\) are such that when \(\sqrt{y}\) is plotted against \(\log_2(x + 1)\), where \(x > - 1\), a straight line is obtained which passes through (2, 10.4) and (4, 15.4).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 127, 144, 146]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 127, 411, 146]]<|/det|>
Find \(\sqrt{y}\) in terms of \(\log_2(x + 1)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 127, 920, 146]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 390, 146, 409]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 390, 418, 409]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(y\) when \(x = 15\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 390, 920, 409]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 96, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 146, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 826, 96]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the normal to the curve \(y = x^{3} + x^{2} - 4x + 6\) at the point (1, 4).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 94]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 69, 756, 91]]<|/det|>
**DO NOT USE A CALCULATOR IN THIS PART OF THE QUESTION.**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 101, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
Find the exact \(x\)-coordinate of each of the two points where the normal cuts the curve again. [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 109, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
The first three terms of an arithmetic progression are \(x\), \(5x - 4\) and \(8x + 2\). Find \(x\) and the common difference.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 720, 92]]<|/det|>
The first three terms of a geometric progression are \(y\), \(5y - 4\) and \(8y + 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 102, 181, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 102, 457, 121]]<|/det|>
Find the two possible values of \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 102, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 599, 180, 616]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 599, 818, 618]]<|/det|>
For each of these values of \(y\), find the corresponding value of the common ratio.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 599, 920, 618]]<|/det|>
